column4: My firefox won't start because I "have another instance running already", and when i do sudo kill XXXXX, it accepts the command but doesn't actually kill firefox...any ideas?
firefox uses a lock file, which sometimes sticks around if the browser crashes. look for it in your .mozilla/firefox/<profileid> directory. remove it and try again.
or have you verified that a firefox process is actually running? (the error message is not proof that another firefox process is actually running)
i'm dong ps -efa | grep firefox, and it seems to be running with the id 27689
what's the process status from ps?
is that the column after the pid?
no, just give the whole line, please.
can you try "ps auxww | grep firefox"?
hmm...uninterruptible. is there are a lot of hard drive activity at the moment?
anything else I can try?  Or do I need to reboot?
if you set the variable MOZ_NO_REMOTE via "export MOZ_NO_REMOTE=1", and then start firefox from the terminal, does it allow you to choose a profile?
I typed "export MOZ_NO_REMOTE=1" then "firefox" and I'm getting the same existing firefox error as before
and you said you had moved the profile directory under .mozilla?
and if you move that file elsewhere?
i hate to suggest a reboot, but that would probably be the quickest solution under the circumstances
I appreciate all your help, I've got a lunch meeting I have to run to - I'll be back in an hour or so to try and get this...Thanks for your time though
